items.summary: Implement the Version 11.1 Short-circuit Recovery simulator: when a forward leg fails, simulate swapping remaining virtual assets back to ICP using the most liquid direct pool chosen by 1-minute moving average TVL. Use xmiu5 as the ckBTC/ICP fallback pool and ybilh as the BOB/ICP fallback pool. Liquidity selection must be based on the 1-minute moving average TVL computed from existing ring-buffer snapshots (do not introduce a new TVL buffer if ring-buffer data already exists).

Minimal Evolutionary Lab logging for Version 11.1: persist only the final net virtual profit/loss (net shadow return) from each triangular shadow run to the existing Evolutionary Lab logging surface in the backend. Do not add per-leg status UI or the Path Visualizer in this version.
Confirm the Version 11.1 triangular shadow simulation uses a fixed notional input amount of exactly 100 ICP as the starting asset for every run of the ICP → ckBTC → BOB → ICP path.

Implement Version 11.1 core triangular shadow arbitrage simulation in the single Motoko actor, using the strict ICPSwap pool route and pool IDs: xmiu5 (ICP/ckBTC) → 73nps (ckBTC/BOB) → sys7q (BOB/ICP). Use constant-product swap math (x*y=k) and apply a 0.3% fee per leg when computing expected outputs.

Define and enforce Version 11.1 leg failure conditions in shadow mode: treat a leg as failed if either (a) pool data fetch fails for that leg, or (b) computed slippage for that leg exceeds 0.5%. When a failure happens at any leg, stop the forward path immediately and trigger Short-circuit Recovery.
